OOC Somehow I knew you'd say that.

Foxfingers had been chased enough times to know he was being herded. 
He knew that they wanted him to go this way. He'd continue to play 
the game a little longer, he might be able to use this to his 
advantage. Three bots chasing him meant three more samples for 
Veratis. If only Veratis believed in weaponry. He quickly scampered 
down the hall. A musky smell filled his nostrils. He figured it was 
the brig. He was playing right into thier hands. Or at least thats 
what he wanted them to think. KitKat was getting closer, he didn't 
have to look back to know that, he was staying a step ahead of her 
both mentally and physically.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::KitKat::
> 
> She smiled as she started to get closer to the fox.  He's headed 
> straight for the brig, she thought.  She smiled.  This fox was 
> trapping himself for her. This was going to be a nice day when she 
> cought him.  She didn't wan't him harmed though. She wanted to put 
> him through a mind probe first, then reprogram him.
> She stayed in her dead run after him, with her wolf eyes glaring 
> ahead, trying to keep him in sight.
